 A string enumerator of all the property names that can be used in the filter.

Detailed Description

Control the filter settings on a media list.

Media lists that implement this interface declare themselves as filterable. The filter is applied as an additional constraint to the list.

See also:
sbIMediaList

Definition at line 48 of file sbIFilterableMediaList.idl.

Member Function Documentation

nsIStringEnumerator sbIFilterableMediaList::getFilterValues ( in AString  aPropertyName  ) 

Returns an array of all of the possible values for the given property.

Parameters:
aPropertyName The property name to return values for
Returns:
A string enumerator containing all the possible values for the given property

void sbIFilterableMediaList::removeFilters ( in sbIPropertyArray  aPropertyArray  ) 

Remove property values from an existing filter.

Parameters:
aPropertyName Array of name value pairs to remove property value pairs from the filter. Each property value pair in the array will be removed from the filter if it exists.

void sbIFilterableMediaList::setFilters ( in sbIPropertyArray  aPropertyArray  ) 

Set a new filter configuration.

Parameters:
aPropertyArray Array of name value pairs used to filter the list For each distinct property, the list of values in the filter for that property will be replaced with the supplied values. An empty value will remove the property from the list of filters.

void sbIFilterableMediaList::updateFilters ( in sbIPropertyArray  aPropertyArray  ) 

Update an existing filter.

Parameters:
aPropertyName Array of name value pairs to used to update the current filter configuration. For each distinct property, the list of values in the filter for that propery will be appended to with the supplied values.
